There are several ways of how to participate in the project.

**<i class="icon-comment"></i> Make suggestions**

* In order to make `OpenRepGrid` suit your needs we need to know what features you need, what you miss and what you feel needs improvement. So please don't hesitate to [tell us](#get-in-touch). Just share your ideas in the comment section at the bottom of each page. 

       
**<i class="icon-pencil"></i> Build the documentation** 

* If you feel the documentation needs improvement or you have a use case you would like to see in the documentation, just [tell us](#get-in-touch) in the comment section. Or if you have a draft you would like to add, [send it to us](#get-in-touch).

**<i class="icon-align-justify"></i> Supply code snippets** 

* If have some basic R knowledge and come up with some code snippets just [send them](#get-in-touch) and we will take care to integrate your ideas into the package.

**<i class="icon-user"></i> Join us on github** 

* If you have solid R knowledge just hammer out some code and [send it to us](#get-in-touch) :) Or, if you are familiar with git, fork the [OpenRepGrid repo](https://github.com/markheckmann/OpenRepGrid), make some changes and submit a pull request. Please also [report bugs and suggest enhancements](https://github.com/markheckmann/OpenRepGrid/issues) here.

### Get in touch

You can get in touch in several ways:

* Post your ideas, remarks and suggestions in the comment section at the bottom of each page. We will get back to your comments ASAP.
* Write an email to openrepgrid@gmail.com.
* There is a [shared Dropbox folder for contributors](https://www.dropbox.com/sh/453dhcf2b0i2tq6/AAC09Qkg5jMGl2ZAh2EYi7-Da?dl=0). Have a look at it. If you want to get access to it e.g. to add some stuff, write an email.
* (Expert level): Post a bug, issue or enhancement directly on [github](https://github.com/markheckmann/OpenRepGrid/issues).


### Contributors

The following people have contributed to the development of `OpenRepGrid` in one of the above ways. Become one of them!

* [Mark Heckmann](http://www.markheckmann.de) (package maintainer)
* Richard C. Bell (thanks for some FORTRAN code and for the joint work on [bootstrap clustering](slideshare.net/markheckmann/a-new-development-in-the-hierarchical-clustering-of-repertory-grid-data-24444362))
